bigshot
Class EquirectangularToCubic

java.lang.Object
  bigshot.EquirectangularToCubic

public class EquirectangularToCubic
extends java.lang.Object

Transforms an equirectangular image map to rectilinear images. Used to create a cube map for bigshot.VRPanorama.

Constructor Summary
EquirectangularToCubic()
          Creates a new transform instance.

public EquirectangularToCubic input(Image input)

                                     double op,

Sets the initial transform offsets (used to level a bubble).

Parameters:
oy - the yaw angle in degrees
op - the pitch angle in degrees
or - the roll angle in degrees

size

public EquirectangularToCubic size(int width,
                                   int height)
Sets the output image size in pixels.

oversampling

public EquirectangularToCubic oversampling(int oversampling)
If greater than one, oversamples each output pixel using a grid of oversampling * oversampling samples. Use together with jitter(double) to avoid moire and aliasing.

Parameters:
oversampling - the amount of oversampling along each axis of the output image. Must be >= 1.

jitter

public EquirectangularToCubic jitter(double jitter)
Adds a random jitter to the sampling. Use together with oversampling(int) to avoid moire and aliasing.

Parameters:
jitter - the jitter, in units of one output pixel

                throws java.lang.Exception

transformToFace

public static Image transformToFace(Image in,
                                    int outputSize,
                                    double vfov,
                                    double oy,
                                    double op,
                                    double or,
                                    double yaw,
                                    double pitch,
                                    double roll)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Transforms an equirectangular map to a rectilinear image.

Parameters:
in - the equirectangular image map
outputSize - the size (width and height), in pixels, of each face
vfov - the vertical field of view, in degrees
oy - the initial yaw offset, in degrees
op - the initial pitch offset, in degrees
or - the initial roll offset, in degrees
yaw - the yaw angle of the viewer, in degrees
pitch - the pitch angle of the viewer, in degrees
roll - the roll angle of the viewer, in degrees
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

transformToFace

                                   double oy,
                                   double op,
                                   double or,
                                   double yaw,
                                   double pitch,
                                   double roll)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
Transforms an equirectangular map to a rectilinear image.

Parameters:
imageName - the equirectangular image map
output - the output file name
outputSize - the size (width and height), in pixels, of each face
vfov - the vertical field of view, in degrees
oy - the initial yaw offset, in degrees
op - the initial pitch offset, in degrees
or - the initial roll offset, in degrees
yaw - the yaw angle of the viewer, in degrees
pitch - the pitch angle of the viewer, in degrees
roll - the roll angle of the viewer, in degrees
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

transformToFaces

public static java.io.File[] transformToFaces(java.io.File imageName,
                                              java.io.File outputBase,
                                              int outputSize,
                                              double oy,
                                              double op,
                                              double or)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
Transforms an equirectangular map to six VR cube faces.

Parameters:
imageName - the equirectangular image map
outputBase - the base directory to output the cube faces to
outputSize - the size (width and height), in pixels, of each face
oy - the initial yaw offset
op - the initial pitch offset
or - the initial roll offset
Returns:
the resulting faces as PNG files in the outputBase directory. They are named "face_f.png", "face_r.png", "face_b.png", "face_l.png", "face_u.png" and "face_d.png", for "Front", "Right", "Back", "Left", "Up" and "Down" respectively.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
